**Zyx, the Astral Projection** 
(Image available at: http://galacticconnection.com/galactic-round-table/are-you-a-guardian/ )

https://gp1.wac.edgecastcdn.net/802892/http_public_production/photos/images/6953483/original/1315045822_MEDITATE_WATER_WARRIOR.jpg?1463546224

**Role: Jungler/Fighter**

-----------------------------

**Stats:**

> Health: 583 - 2028 (85)
> Health Regen: 8.26 - 21.01 (0.75)
> Energy: 200
> Energy Regen: 50 per 5 seconds
> Attack Range: 125 (Melee)
> Attack Damage: 56 - 119 (3.1)
> Attack Speed: 0.651 (3%)
> Armor: 26.88 - 86.4 (3.5)
> Magic Resist: 32.1 - 53.4 (1.25)
> Movement Speed: 345

------------------------------

**Kit:**

http://imgur.com/PGVQfbk 
**Passive: Evanescence**

>_ Every 5th autoattack from Zyx grants him 25 Energy and causes him to become **Evanescent** for 1 second. While **Evanescent**, Zyx takes no damage and projectiles pass through him. Abilities that pass through Zyx and strike an ally while he is **Evanescent** deal no damage, lose any crowd control affects, and heal the ally for 5/7.5/10% of Zyx's maximum health. _

http://imgur.com/PDH8ZP2
**Q: Astral Barrage**
 
> COOLDOWN: 14/12/10/8/6 Sec COST: 40 Energy
>
> *Zyx empowers his next 3 autoattacks used in the following 6 seconds. The first 2 attacks have maximum attack speed. The 3rd attack has normal speed but gains 475 range and strikes in a line, dealing (150% Total AD) physical damage to the target and all targets along the way. Enemies struck by the third blow are also slowed by 25/30/35/40/45% for 2 seconds.*

http://imgur.com/vEVdRYi
**W: Spectral Displacement** 

> COOLDOWN: 18/16/14/12/10 Sec COST: 100/90/80/70/60 Energy 
>
> *Zyx roots himself in place and produces an untargetable **Spectre** that can move freely for 4 seconds. Zyx remains in place as he moves the **Spectre** and is able to take damage normally. The **Spectre** has 10/15/20/25/30% increased movement speed and can pass through terrain, but doing so reduces the ability's duration by 1 second. At the end of the ability’s duration, Zyx travels to the **Spectre’s** location and erupts, dealing 60/95/130/165/200 (+100% Bonus AD) magic damage to enemies within 350 units.*

http://imgur.com/cKRfsCr
**E: Re-embodiment/Disembodiment** 

> COOLDOWN: 20/19/18/17/16 Sec COST: 100 Energy RANGE: 500
> 
> ***Passive:*** *Passing through an enemy champion or possessing a large monster refunds half of the energy cost and halves the cooldown of this ability. Zyx has greatly reduced vision while **Re-embodied**.*
>
> ***Active:***
>
> ***Re-embodiment-*** *Zyx dashes to hide himself inside the target minion or monster for up to 6/9/12/15/18 seconds or until the target is slain, becoming untargetable in the process. While embodied, Zyx is unable to move or take any action as the target continues to act normally.*
> 
> ***Disembodiment-*** *Zyx can reactivate this ability while **Re-embodied** to violently leave his target’s body, returning to his normal form and dealing 80/130/180/230/280 (+0.7 AP) magic damage to the target and all targets within 350 units.*

http://imgur.com/Ng3phz5
**R: Takeover**

> COOLDOWN: 100/85/70 Sec COST: None RANGE: 625
>
> _Zyx channels for 1 second in an attempt to transfer himself into an enemy champion for 5 seconds. If successful, Zyx becomes untargetable and deals the target 4/5/6% (+1% per 100 AP) Max Health as magic damage per second. Zyx wrests control of the enemy champion's movement for the final 2 seconds of **Takeover**, granting him the ability to move the champion at will in the direction he chooses._

-----

**Lore:**

> Zyx, one of the Black Rose’s finest magicians, but a faded memory now. I looked up to him. That was… until he became soft, tarnished by his studies of the stars and spiritual magics.
> 
> He spent a great deal of time in his studies, perfecting the art of astral projection that died with him, something I envied. To impact and move about the world around you without even using your physical body… it opened up an entirely different set of opportunities. It was in my attempt to recover and harness this lost art that I discovered my own magical prowess to teleport and project doppelgängers, but I still fell short of my deepest desires. 
> 
> But I digress, Zyx’s naivety in trusting others and obsession with realms unknown were his downfall. The more he studied projection, the more time he spent as a spiritual being than his physical self. It wasn’t long before his apprentice grew weary of his ever-growing fancy and weakening body as a result. I could see it in his aging skin and slowing movement. The toll of his work was steadily increasing. I wouldn’t be taught any further by someone so blind as to not see his own degradation in plain sight. 
> 
> A legend, he had fallen from such heights, I couldn’t let the madness continue. I saw his body there, sound asleep, vulnerable. I could tell that it wasn’t a typical slumber by the faint azure glow about his person as he lay there resting. He wasn’t merely asleep; his spirit was projected who knows where, but there was no sign of him here in this place. And so I spared him a slow death and myself a poor master that very night.
> 
> I’m writing you now Lord Swain, as rumors speak of a glimmering blue figure making appearances of late. I fear the man may have perished, but the spirit still lingers. This doesn't bode well.
>
> ---Matron of the Black Rose

Thanks for the feedback! Here are some brief responses to selected questions that I hope clears things up.

> ...would Zyx be Kicked out of their body due to there Being nothing there? 

That's definitely an interesting aspect I didn't think about before, however, I'm inclined to say it doesn't kick him out (just as ignite or any dot would continue).

> also another question about the champion, i personally think his W is too "All in"...

I definitely agree that this is an all or nothing initiating device (can be used to escape, but doesn't work this way as effectively). However, it's current iteration was intended to provide unique and fun ability to traverse the jungle and gank. I didn't want there to be a choice on traveling to the wisp or not because it forces there to be thought before activation. Do I have my a reasonable path planned out? Additionally, I didn't want to simply make a more powerful version of Zed's living shadow. With Zed, you have to zone both his original and show location. Because he is an assassin, he needs this sort of mind game to survive; whereas, I don't think a bruiser like Zyx does. However, your idea is definitely fun and worth me pondering further. Thanks!
 
> Finally, when it comes to his passive, i understand the shielding, but to restore ALL of your health...

I will have to adjust the tooltip to make things a little more clear. What really happens with his passive is mindful decision-making. Zyx takes 20% of the damage the target he is possessing takes (his target still takes 100% damage) up to 40% of Zyx's max health after which Zyx no longer takes damage, but his target still does. If he or an ally kill the possessed target, Zyx regains that up to 40% damage he took and a small shield. This makes Zyx sacrifice health for using E on lane minions, sneaky counter jungling (i.e. hiding in baron), or poor decision of ultimate target (i.e. ulting the enemy tank). However, smart plays reward him with a shield. If he was 45% before damage and took 40% health (putting him at 5%), after the target is killed, he'd go back to 45% health not 100%. 
 
Thanks again for the feedback, I'll be sure to return the favor :)

Fair enough good sir :) I'll take your thoughts to mind. I did have a mechanic to allow counterplay... but it's super experimental so I have never unveiled it, but while I have your attention and good will maybe I can run it past you?

Here goes the experimental version (Changes are bolded):

R: Takeover

COOLDOWN: 100/85/70 Sec COST: None RANGE: 625

Zyx channels for 1 second in an attempt to transfer himself into an enemy champion for **3 seconds**. If successful, Zyx becomes untargetable and deals the target **5/7/9% (+2% per 100 AP)** Max Health as magic damage per second. **All of Zyx's abilities** become **Mind Grapple** during this time.

**Mind Grapple**- Prevents the use of the corresponding ability by the enemy champion taken over and grants Zyx control of their movement for up to **2 seconds**. All of Zyx's abilities share a cooldown during this time. **COOLDOWN 5 Sec**

Enemies inflicted with Mind Grapple may activate the suppressed ability to enter Stasis for the remainder of Takeover, absorbing damage and healing Zyx for any damage they would have taken during this period (after damage reduction would apply). Healing is capped at 50% of Zyx's Maximum Health.




This offers afflicted enemies the chance to avoid the damage and loss of movement and still benefits Zyx in that he recoups some health and still manages to prevent an enemies actions.

Very interesting and novel idea you've got here, Flux.  I'm getting an AP Zed vibe from Zyx, which isn't a bad thing.  Some key concerns I noticed while reading-

1- I really like the passive but I don't like its reliance on auto attacks to proc.  I feel like it has the opportunity to really let Zyx players make some flashy plays (like Zed) to survive things they shouldn't survive.  They're always going to be auto attacking so the passive becomes a "nice thing that happens every few seconds" instead of a cool tool the player has.  I guess what I'm saying is that it lacks agency.  I wish this passive was actually an active ability.

2- I'm not sure how an auto attack can transform into a skillshot.  I'm imagining the first two autos and then the third striking and... where does the skillshot emanate from?  Auto attacks don't have very precise aiming requirements, so it feels like the angle of the skillshot will be kind of random, and therefore unreliable and unrewarding.  What if, while active, Zyx gains increased attack speed.  If able to auto attack three times in the 6 second activation, the ability can be recast as a skillshot?

3- The E is very interesting but I also worry about it.  It requires minions or monsters which means that it likely won't have much use in a lot of different circumstances.  I like the idea of "hiding" in a neutral unit and then exploding out, however.  I don't understand why dashing and hiding deals damage, though.  Seems like it should be a short range dash to merge with the unit, then gain vision and otherwise be able to hide there for a while.  Maybe even increase the duration to a max of 30 seconds or so, to really let them camp and stalk their prey if they want.  The energy refund on both hits is a nice idea, but again I think it would be exceptionally rare in practice.  All energy using champions have a way of regenerating energy faster, so I like that you tried it here, but I think it should be moved somewhere else.

4- I have to be blunt and honest here and say that the Ultimate just doesn't work for me.  It removes a huge amount of control from another player in the game and I can easily see this being one of the most anti-fun abilities in the whole game.  It fits thematically and I like the idea from that angle, but in practice I really feel like this ability would be frustrating and broken.

This is great! Thank you for the feedback. I don't mind at all if you're critical as it helps develop the idea further. I'll address your points by number:

1. I agree somewhat with the passive lacking that interaction quality. We see similar things with Kassadin or Fizz who get passive defense (end of story, no engagement). There was another iteration that involved proc from ability cast. In that state, Q's low cooldown would offer a similar response. The passive would also offer brief compensation for W's vulnerable root. However, I opted towards the route I did because of his role as a jungler/top laner. I wanted to offer a means of damage reduction (in this case through evasion) that fit the role. Secondly, we actually see a  way for Zyx to engage his passive through his Q even as it is now because it's a mini-auto steroid. Sure, it will offer some auto-pilot procs, but in those moments where it matters, it can be used to stay alive where otherwise death would have occurred. Does this clear things up a bit? In a way I don't want him to be so engaged with the passive that he can choose to become invulnerable regardless of scenario by just using abilities (if he was a mid laner I would reconsider). His passive is most comparable to Pantheon.

2. Perhaps I wasn't so clear in my wording, but I hope this explanation helps. All three attacks are treated as autos. The first two are completely vanilla in that they only receive the attack speed boost. For the 3rd auto, it still operates as an auto-attack in every sense, but it gains 475 range (moving from melee to ranged in status). The other aspect of this 3rd attack is that it is piercing. So Zyx can click on the target of the auto (or continue autoing if in range as the 3rd strike doesn't reset the auto sequence), and essentially a piercing light effect of Lucian occurs. The only difference is that it is auto-based. This is done to allow some poke in Top lane. I.e. auto two minions and then extend for a poke on the champion.

3. I'm completely satisfied as a jungler and laner especially with the opportunities to use this ability. I don't believe finding a chance to use it will be too difficult, especially in the jungle. I also didn't want to give him a free dash as he already has pretty good mobility from other sources. I wish that he could really stalk his prey longer, but unfortunately, from a laning aspect this would let him ride a minion wave from base to his tower. I didn't know if that was quite fair, but it's definitely something I'm willing to tweak (I originally had a longer time). The damage via dash to the target coupled with return of energy and cooldown was an incentive to use the ability for more than mere escape as it would encourage timing and risk management (do I go for the damage/refund, risking pushing too far up in lane and being ganked as a result?). I removed the damage portion as it was ancillary, now it refunds solely on passing through a champion. Zyx cannot regenerate energy while re-embodied now. So this allows for a longer hiding factor.

4. I understand your feelings here. It took me ages to come to a "mind control" ultimate that required knowledge to use as well as thematic tie-in and some balance. Lower damage and the channel was a complete must. Zyx has to use this strategically, and most likely during a team-fight or gank only. This being said, I do agree it could be an anti-fun ability. I don't think it takes too much control away, rather the "anti-fun" ability could be from small counterplay options. Let me explain:

-A 2 second targeted silence (on only one ability during the ultimate, and it cannot block an ultimate's use from the victim) is far less OP than what we see from what spammable CC in this game brings (i.e. Cho'gath silence or Xerath stun)
-2 seconds of movement control isn't as powerful as it may seem... 
-His entire ultimate can be cleansed with either the summoner spell or items like QSS.
-With only 1 second of reflex wiggle room, Zyx has to know his exact plan for use before he ults or risk failing to maximize its potential
-Being absent from the teamfight for 5 seconds means Zyx has to make his ultimate count.

Example of ult in action:

Zyx ults enemy adc, Lucian. He begins with silencing his dash, then proceeds to move him away from the teamfight for 2 seconds. HOWEVER, during this entire process, Lucian can still use his Q/W/R. This means Lucian can still potentially contribute. Another quick example. Zyx ults Ahri and prevents her from using Charm and moves her away from the teamfight. Ahri can use her ultimate to fight the movement away and return back to land her Q and W and finish off your team's adc. In this case, Ahri has plenty control still.

What do you think? Does this make things clear? What needs tweaking the most after reviewing my response? ;) feel free to upvote too if you like (no pressure though).
